channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Bro's in Control
channel.desc: Adam and Joe become busy bees for a gunge-fuelled challenge where they must each fight to collect the most nectar and win Callum's ultimate respect.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Next Step
channel.desc: Pete tries to juggle regionals and the Brawl, while Ethan and Olive become suspicious.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Next Step
channel.desc: A-Troupe struggle under the weight of all the secrets they have kept from each other.

channel.title: OFF Air
channel.desc: This channel is off air, or it has temporarily no EPG data yet.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Gardeners' World
channel.desc: With a bank holiday weekend to look forward to, Adam Frost has a few things to be getting on with in the garden. His mini-meadow needs some attention, he's got an autumn container to plant up, and in the borders, there are seeds to collect.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
channel.desc: The sewers tackle a pattern for children's dungarees, re-purpose maternity wear into toddler outfits, giving new life to old garments, and design outfits inspired by their childhood dream jobs.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Beechgrove Garden
channel.desc: Calum Clunie has been growing for the Fife veg and flower shows since he was 15 years old, and now he has an allotment in Leven that has dedicated to growing the largest leeks and most dazzling dahlias.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Train
channel.desc: A true story of wartime heroism about a French railway inspector who goes up against the Nazis in order to prevent a trainload of France's most treasured paintings from being stolen.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Final Score
channel.desc: A panel of experts run through the afternoon's football results.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Flog It!
channel.desc: Presenter Paul Martin and experts Thomas Plant and Catherine Southon are at London Zoo on the prowl for antiques and collectibles to sell at auction. Collectibles rub shoulders with antiques, and as ever, there are a few surprises in the saleroom. Paul visits London's temple to all things aesthetic, the Victoria and Albert Museum, to discover its fascinating history and explore the new Architecture Gallery.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Live: The Hundred
channel.desc: Coverage of The Hundred 100-ball cricket tournament.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: We Want the Funk!
channel.desc: A comprehensive voyage through the roots and history of funk music, from its African and jazz roots to James Brown's early work and the rise of Parliament-Funkadelic.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Electric Proms
channel.desc: From the Roundhouse in Camden, as part of the Electric Proms, James Brown performs a selection of his greatest songs with his 24-piece band plus the London Community Gospel Choir.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Shaft
channel.desc: A supercool detective investigating a kidnapping becomes embroiled in a war between the white mafia and the black mob.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Luzzu
channel.desc: A poor Maltese fisherman faces temptation to sell his wooden fishing boat and join a black-market operation that's decimating the Mediterranean fish population and the livelihoods of local families.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Parenthood
channel.desc: Parents must constantly balance risk and reward when raising young in open grasslands. Whilst abundant grass promises plentiful food and places to call home, this alone cannot guarantee success.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: This Is BBC TWO
channel.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The A to Z of TV Gardening
channel.desc: Carol Kirkwood explores gardening subjects which begin with the letter A.

channel.name: BBC Two NL

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: OFF Air
channel.desc: This channel is off air, or it has temporarily no EPG data yet.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Breakfast
channel.desc: The BBC's Breakfast programme features the latest news, sport, business, weather and other items on a daily basis.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Beechgrove Garden
channel.desc: A lot of the action is in the greenhouse as Kirsty and Brian will be taste-testing the chillies that they first featured at the start of May.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Weatherman Walking
channel.desc: The final episode in the series and Derek Brockway, the Weatherman, walks along a stunning and often overlooked stretch of coastline dominated by the Second Severn Crossing or Prince of Wales Bridge. On his journey he rings an ancient church bell, finds a water scorpion which breathes through its bottom, and learns about the `Rogiet Hoard' and discovers how the village of Sudbrook evolved. He also wades into the River Severn in the footsteps of ancient fisherman and finishes in Chepstow.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
channel.desc: More mouthwatering recipes from Poppy O'Toole, Paul Ainsworth, Tony Singh and Marianne Lumb. Meanwhile, Rick Stein and the Hairy Bikers head out and about across the UK.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Nigel Slater's Simple Suppers
channel.desc: Nigel transforms favourite classic recipes by giving them a new twist. Whether it's a makeover for the traditional cottage pie, or an exciting new version of the time-honoured apple tart, he proves that it's easy to jazz up our favourite dishes.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Live: Women's Rugby World Cup
channel.desc: Ireland face Japan in the group stage of the Women's Rugby World Cup 2025.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Chariots of Fire
channel.desc: Social pressure and personal turmoil beset two British athletes on their way to glory in the 1924 Olympics.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Fake or Fortune?
channel.desc: The team return to two portraits of Black British women from the 18th and 19th centuries. How have recent changes in society transformed the fortunes of these important artworks?

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Flog It!
channel.desc: Paul Martin and experts Mark Stacey, Anita Manning and David Fletcher are at Tatton Park in Cheshire.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC Proms
channel.desc: Every unmissable concert from the world's greatest classical music festival.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Top Gear
channel.desc: The `Top Gear' boys welcome in the New Year with a special selection of films and guests from the vaults celebrating the best of British. Even James Bond would be jealous of the selection of British cars put through their paces by Jeremy, Richard and James, ranging from the frightening fast Aston Martin V8 Vantage, Noble M15, and Lotus Exige, to the ludicrous luxury of the Rolls Royce Phantom.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Murder Case
channel.desc: With unprecedented access to the police investigation and criminal trial, the shocking truth of what really happened on the night Tony Parsons disappeared is discovered.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Godfather
channel.desc: The violent story of a Mafia family fighting to establish supremacy in the American business world following World War II, where an assassination attempt leaves Vito Corleone too ill to run the family business.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: MasterChef
channel.desc: It's week three of the heats, and the latest home cooks are ready to bring their A-game to the kitchen. If they reach the standards expected of them, they could claim a MasterChef apron.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Destination X
channel.desc: Tensions mount as the passengers are given the opportunity to scupper each other in a challenge that will test their memory and their reflexes, as well as their loyalty to each other.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Here We Go
channel.desc: After becoming the victim of an online scam, Rachel decides to get even. Amy is spotted by a modelling agency.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: This Is BBC TWO
channel.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Bargain Hunt
channel.desc: Roo Irvine peers into perfectly made doll's houses created by a remarkable centenarian in the Pembrokeshire seaside town of Newport. In nearby Narberth, the race is on for the teams.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Antiques Roadshow
channel.desc: Featuring Firstsite contemporary art gallery in Colchester, Essex, where among the gems are trophies from the earliest days of aviation, a copper dish twice rescued from a skip, and an antique that sings.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Match of the Day
channel.desc: The world's most famous football show, with the big names and the big games from the Premier League.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC News
channel.desc: A comprehensive compilation of the latest and the most important news stories, updates and developments from the UK and different parts of the world.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Impossible
channel.desc: Contestants compete across the series, scoring points by answering questions correctly. However, they must avoid the impossible answers, otherwise they will be eliminated from the show until the next day.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Bridge of Lies
channel.desc: A family team of four, Anita, Rajan, Bobby and Sanj, take on the Bridge of Lies. One by one they all face the Bridge, choosing who faces each crossing depending on the question category. They must cross the Bridge by stepping on the truths and avoiding the lies, earning money for each correct answer.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Tournament
channel.desc: Eight contestants compete in a series of fast-paced quiz battles in an attempt to eliminate their opponents from the day's game and walk away with a cash prize.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Great British Menu
channel.desc: It's national finals week on Great British Menu, where the winners from the regional heats compete to earn a place on the menu of a spectacular banquet celebrating animation and illustration for Paddington's 65th birthday.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Big Cats About the House
channel.desc: Big cat expert Giles Clark adopts jaguar cub Maya and hand-raises her at home while raising funds for wild cats. At the sanctuary, Giles has his hands full, improving the lives of the fifty cats that live there.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Flog It!
channel.desc: The team are at the Old College, part of Aberystwyth University on the west coast of Wales, a popular student destination. Experts David Harper and Raj Bisram are on hand to find a selection of objects to take to auction. David values some motoring memorabilia, while Raj is drawn to some rare Welsh records. Meanwhile, Paul Martin discovers how, throughout generations of storytelling, the myth of Merlin has been connected to the heart of Wales.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
channel.desc: Every day this week, celebrity contestants Diarmuid Gavin, Roo Irvine, John Kearns and Claire Richards take on a series of quiz rounds selected by the host, quiz legend Richard Osman.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
channel.desc: Every day this week, celebrity contestants Diarmuid Gavin, Roo Irvine, John Kearns and Claire Richards take on a series of quiz rounds selected by the host, quiz legend Richard Osman.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: For Rent: Rooms Under the Radar
channel.desc: The booming rental market hides a crisis. An investigation into the hidden world of unlicensed shared housing, where people live in overcrowded, hazardous and unsafe conditions.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Mastermind
channel.desc: Clive Myrie hosts another heat of the classic quiz where contenders take the black chair. The subjects include, Barack Obama, the Dambusters Raid and Real Madrid from 2000 to the present.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Only Connect
channel.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts the quiz where knowledge only gets you so far, the vital extra ingredients are logic and lateral thinking. One of the teams comes straight in with an answer after seeing just two clues, red blood and hot sugar.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: University Challenge
channel.desc: In another first-round heat, students from Trinity College, Cambridge take on a team from Linacre College, Oxford. Amol Rajan asks the questions.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Disaster at Sea: The Piper Alpha Story
channel.desc: On 6 July 1988, a series of explosions destroyed the Piper Alpha oil platform, with 167 men killed and only 61 survivors. It remains the world's worst offshore disaster. Follow the story of how the disaster unfolded.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Destination X
channel.desc: After a shock elimination, the X-bus continues its journey towards the ?100,000 prize with just five players remaining. Two alliances have formed and plans are being hatched, but can they play nice?

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Policing Paradise
channel.desc: Police confront an angry group illegally boozing in public, a constable faces a dilemma over whether to arrest a traffic offender he knows, and officers patrol Bermuda's coastline.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: This Is BBC TWO
channel.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Bargain Hunt
channel.desc: Army food has evolved dramatically over the past 200 years, from basic tinned beef to flavourful chicken tikka masala. Eric Knowles discovers the history of military rations from a retired lieutenant colonel.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Bidding Room
channel.desc: A surprise appearance from an Elvis impersonator has the dealers all shook up, then Clayton's jade disc leaves them green with envy. Jason continues to bring the bling, with a uranium glass jewellery set that radiates class.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Repair Shop: On the Road
channel.desc: Dom and Mark Stuckey aim to restore an outdated big red bus. Pauline has a curious astrological artifact, a celestial projector, that needs repair. The siren call of another heritage craft lures Will to a Victorian factory in Ironbridge Gorge.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC News
channel.desc: A comprehensive compilation of the latest and the most important news stories, updates and developments from the UK and different parts of the world.

channel.desc: Contestants compete across the series, scoring points by answering questions correctly. However, they must avoid the impossible answers, otherwise they will be eliminated from the show until the next day.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Bridge of Lies
channel.desc: Four friends, Lauren, Kate, Katie and Emily, take on the Bridge of Lies. They must step on the truths and avoid the lies, earning money for each correct answer. Step on a lie and the Bridge will halve their money; step on three and they are out.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Beechgrove Garden
channel.desc: Kirsty creates four practical, pretty and eco-friendly garden items from recycled materials. From a living picture frame filled with succulents constructed from leftover wood at Beechgrove, to a fairy garden made out of broken terracotta pots and a terrarium out of a second-hand glass teapot.

channel.title: Live: The Hundred
channel.desc: Coverage of The Hundred 100-ball cricket tournament.

channel.desc: Coverage of The Hundred 100-ball cricket tournament.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: QI XL
channel.desc: Join Sandi Toksvig for a completely random selection of quite Interesting information. With Bill Bailey, Daliso Chaponda, Sally Phillips, and Alan Davies.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Don Rodolfo
channel.desc: Don Rodolfo is a shameless libertine, the greatest swordsman the world has ever seen and a total butthead. Now barricaded inside a remote tavern, surrounded by the Catalan army and facing almost certain death.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Godfather, Part III
channel.desc: Ex-don, Michael Corleone, tries to legitimise his family's interests while at the same time keeping his daughter out of the family's seamier dealings. His descent accelerates as the Vatican becomes involved and events from the past conspire to keep him involved in a world he is trying to forget.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: MasterChef
channel.desc: It's the second heat of the week, and the newest cohort of brave cooks are each hoping to win one of the four MasterChef aprons on offer - their ticket to the rest of the competition.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: MasterChef
channel.desc: Esteemed food critic and writer Jimi Famurewa sets the brief for the week's quarter-final - to create a modern American classic that will make him feel like he's back in the USA.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Chess Masters: The Endgame
channel.desc: The five remaining players from the second heat return to the Great Hall to battle it out for a place in the quarter-finals. The sense of trepidation is palpable as they face a mind-bending chess puzzle called 'the five queens'.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: This Is BBC TWO
channel.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Escape to the Country
channel.desc: Jules Hudson helps two retired drama teachers swapping Sheffield for Devon's coastal tranquility. He showcases splendid properties, including a charming period cottage with a stunning garden near the beach, as they seek countryside calm.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Travelling Auctioneers
channel.desc: Izzie and Robin get rummaging and restoring in York. Could a tractor, a horse and a whole heap of toy cars help a special little girl get the treatment she needs?

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
channel.desc: Reality TV star and autism campaigner Christine McGuinness takes on `Coronation Street' actor Colson Smith. Also enjoying the ride, and supplying some much-needed know-how, are antiques experts Irita Marriot and Hettie Jago.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: SOS: Extreme Rescues
channel.desc: A race to rescue eight-year-old twins, parents and grandparents lost in a storm, a sheepdog is stuck on a quarry ledge, and an RAF team help rescue multiple casualties stuck in the snow.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Grand Tours of Scotland's Rivers
channel.desc: Paul explores the River Don from its source in the Grampians near Cock Bridge, downstream to Aberdeen. He meets kilted Highlanders, skilled sculptors, eccentrics and bees along the way.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Saving Lives at Sea
channel.desc: A 999 call comes in from the young son of a windsurfer in trouble; the Mudeford crew battle 80mph winds in an increasingly desperate search.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Great Art Fraud
channel.desc: Art's most sensational fraud. Inigo Philbrick becomes one of the art world's most successful dealers. But there's a secret: he is living lavishly on millions conned from collectors.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Limbs in the Loch: Catching a Killer
channel.desc: News of the grim discovery at one of Scotland's most famous beauty spots quickly reaches the tabloid press, and speculation of a gangland killing ensues.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Newsnight
channel.desc: Featuring extensive coverage of the day's top national and international news stories, along with explanations about the context and potential aftereffects.

channel.desc: The latest weather forecast.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Miriam Margolyes Discovers New Zealand
channel.desc: Miriam Margolyes embarks on a road trip around New Zealand's North Island, discovering a country with a unique heritage. She also finds herself at her first ever rugby match - a game she has always thought she loathed.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Saving Lives at Sea
channel.desc: The Newhaven crew make a desperate attempt to convince a solo yachtsman that he needs rescuing. When his anchor line snaps, he is at the mercy of the rolling swells and the storm force winds, and his vessel is smashed up on the breakwater.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Great British Railway Journeys
channel.desc: Michael Portillo is in Ironbridge Gorge on the River Severn, a hotbed of 18th-century innovation which features the world's first coke blast iron furnace.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
channel.desc: The sewers tackle a pattern for children's dungarees, re-purpose maternity wear into toddler outfits, giving new life to old garments, and design outfits inspired by their childhood dream jobs.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Confessions of a Brain Surgeon
channel.desc: Top brain surgeon Henry Marsh is facing his own life-threatening diagnosis. He reveals the huge risks and emotional impact of a job filled with difficult life-and-death decisions.

channel.title: This Is BBC TWO
channel.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Homes Under the Hammer
channel.desc: Martin discovers 1960s newspapers in Hampshire, Martel is impressed by the offerings in Yorkshire, and Tommy feels at ease in East London.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Travelling Auctioneers
channel.desc: Auctioneer Christina Trevanion and craftsman Will Kirk take their travelling auction house on the road to help families around the UK cash in on their unknown treasures.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Tournament
channel.desc: Eight contestants compete in a series of fast-paced quiz battles in an attempt to eliminate their opponents from the day's game and walk away with a cash prize.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Great British Menu
channel.desc: The eight regional champions cook their desserts in a bid to secure the last place on the menu at the banquet. Morwenna Banks, voice of Mummy Pig on `Peppa Pig', is the guest judge.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Big Cats About the House
channel.desc: Maya is now seven weeks old and is becoming extremely determined and vocal. Giles is feeling overwhelmed about the enormity of what he has taken on with the sanctuary but is paying close attention to Maya's health, in particular her wavering eyesight and back legs that still seem a little wobbly. Kathryn and Sam are learning the ropes and have fallen in love with their new houseguest. Maya turns from a vulnerable baby into a boisterous toddler.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Flog It!
channel.desc: In Hopetoun House, not far from Edinburgh, antiques experts Adam Partridge and Caroline Hawley find some fascinating antiques. Paul Martin discovers more about Hopetoun House by talking to the people who work and live there.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
channel.desc: Every day this week, celebrity contestants Diarmuid Gavin, Roo Irvine, John Kearns and Claire Richards take on a series of quiz rounds selected by the host, quiz legend Richard Osman.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Rick Stein's Food Stories
channel.desc: Rick ends his UK food tour on home turf, the West Country. He meets a bevy of food pioneers, from Riverford's Guy Singh-Watson, who blazed a trail for organic food before many people even knew what it was, to the famous cheese maker Mary Quicke.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Live: WA Diamond League Athletics
channel.desc: Coverage of 2025 Diamond League meetings.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Great Art Fraud
channel.desc: When Inigo Philbrick is exposed as a fraud, he and his reality TV star girlfriend go on the run. As the scale of his crime becomes clear, a global FBI manhunt begins to bring him to justice.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Limbs in the Loch: Catching a Killer
channel.desc: After human remains belonging to 18-year-old Barry Wallace are found in Loch Lomond, Strathclyde Police identify William Beggs as a suspect and raid his flat. There is no sign of Beggs, but the police make a startling discovery inside the flat.
